channel.title: Problem: SOLVED
channel.description:
I'm sorry this is probably an FAQ but I can't setup my path for some reason..I added my variable and I really tried to get it to work but I kept getting this error: Configuring Server Runtime Settings.ini Finished Configuring Settings.ini Attempting to run server on port 43594. Success! Loaded clipmap in 44ms. [4/28/11 8:05 PM]: Launching Server... [4/28/11 8:05 PM]: Exception in thread "main" [4/28/11 8:05 PM]: java.net.BindEx ception: Address already in use: bind [4/28/11 8:05 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.Net.bind(Native Method) [4/28/11 8:05 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketChannelImpl.bind(Unknown Sourc e) [4/28/11 8:05 PM]: at sun.nio.ch.ServerSocketAdaptor.bind(Unknown Source) [4/28/11 8:05 PM]: at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor.r egisterNew(SocketAcceptor.java:363) [4/28/11 8:05 PM]: at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor.a ccess$800(SocketAcceptor.java:55) [4/28/11 8:05 PM]: at org.apache.mina.transport.socket.nio.SocketAcceptor$W orker.run(SocketAcceptor.java:222) [4/28/11 8:05 PM]: at org.apache.mina.util.NamePreservingRunnable.run(NameP reservingRunnable.java:51) [4/28/11 8:05 PM]: at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) If you see this message, there was an error while running the server. Try Changi ng your JAVA Path Press any key to continue . . .
PLEASE help me if you can :\

item.title: Problem: SOLVED
item.dc:creator: @Dark_Soul3 Dark___Soul
item.description:
@Dark_Soul3 wrote:

I got it…I apologize guys, thanks for the help

Read full topic

item.title: Problem: SOLVED
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

Dark___Soul:

I don’t have anything else running on that port so I don’t understand why it says that =\

Some people have tried utorrent to forward their ports.

Read full topic

item.title: Problem: SOLVED
item.dc:creator: @zyle1992 Zymus
item.description:
@zyle1992 wrote:

[quote=“Keatrm, post:2, topic:392996”]Right edit run, then change your Java version there
(copy and paste your run if you don’t understand)[/quote]

Except that has nothing to do with the error.

The error is that there’s already another service running on port 43594.

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Keatrm Keatrm
item.description:
@Keatrm wrote:

(copy and paste your run if you don’t understand)
